question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc_raw()] [Error Propagation] The ? operator propagates errors (line 70) - are upstream error handlers secure against error injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: RealRpcResponseSender::send()] [Silent Drop] If inner is None (already taken), send() silently does nothing (line 127) - can this mask double-response attempts that indicate bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: sort_peers_by_latency()] [Routing Manipulation] Can Byzantine validators report false latency metrics to manipulate message routing and create asymmetric network partitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Self-Message Priority] Do self-messages have different priority than network messages, potentially allowing validators to prioritize their own proposals unfairly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::new()] [Single Network Topology] Only Validator network is supported (line 173) - can this create a single point of failure if the validator network is partitioned? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Timeout Precision] The timeout is used in tokio::time::timeout (line 84) - can fractional timeout values cause unexpected rounding behavior affecting consensus timing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc_raw()] [Timeout Consistency] Self-messages and network messages may have different timeout behaviors - can this cause some validators to timeout while others succeed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Clock Drift] Are timeouts based on monotonic clocks, or can system clock adjustments cause timeout bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Protocol Array] RPC[0] is hardcoded (line 81) - what happens if RPC array is empty or if indices change, causing array out-of-bounds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: RealRpcResponseSender::send()] [Protocol Mismatch] Can request and response use different protocol versions, causing deserialization to succeed but with wrong semantics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start()] [Protocol Downgrade] Can an attacker force protocol downgrades by manipulating the protocol field (line 191) in RpcRequest events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Asymmetric Message Delivery] Can Byzantine validators selectively timeout self-messages to create asymmetric views where some validators see JWK updates while others don't? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start()] [Message Censorship] Can Byzantine validators in the network layer drop specific RPC requests to censor legitimate JWK proposals? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Targeted Serialization Failure] Can malicious validators cause serialization to fail for specific honest peers while succeeding for Byzantine peers, creating targeted partitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkSender] [Identity Confusion] Can a validator create multiple NetworkSender instances with different author addresses to simulate messages from non-existent validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Message Ordering] If multiple concurrent send_rb_rpc calls target the same receiver, are message ordering guarantees maintained, or can reordering violate consensus invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start()] [Channel Backpressure] When rpc_tx channel is full, messages are dropped with only a warning - can this cause validators to have inconsistent message histories? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::new()] [Initialization Race] Can network events arrive before NetworkTask::start() is called, causing messages to be lost during initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Key Rotation Timing] Can delayed self-messages cause JWK key rotation to occur at inconsistent times across validators, breaking authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start()] [JWK Proposal Validation] Are JWK consensus messages validated for cryptographic correctness before entering the network layer, or can invalid keys propagate? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc_raw()] [Key Material Exposure] Can raw bytes containing sensitive key material be logged or leaked through error messages during transmission? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Empty Message] Can empty JWKConsensusMsg be sent, and if so, how are they handled - can this cause unexpected behavior in consensus logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Recursive Self-Message] Can a self-message handler trigger another self-message, creating infinite recursion or stack overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Empty Peer List] What happens if peers vector is empty - does it return an empty HashMap or error, and can this cause downstream panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: sort_peers_by_latency()] [Empty or Single Peer] Can sorting empty or single-element peer arrays cause issues, or is it a no-op? (Low)
